subtitleNullable: Spectrograms for classification - Rainforest competition (26 classes)
descriptionNullable:
This is a set of spectrograms created by Andrew Scholan (LSE-Kaggles) from  the .wav files shared for the Rainforest Connection Species Audio Detection competitions and re-organised in a way so that each class is placed under a directory (folder) and also it is split into "train-test-valid" sets so it can be used for further classification using keras / tensoflow 

Dataset contains spectograms only from the true positive (tp1) .wav parts (2 second long) - all 26 species selected (frogs and birds). The spectograms are 100 x 200 x 3 and already splitted between train, test and valid folders (71%- 22%- 7%). Files ending with ***.train.png** are filtered on both frequency and time while .

As per @andrewscholan, "Files ending in **train.png** are the ones that have been filtered in both the frequency domain and the time domain. If you like, these are the cat pictures where all we see is the cat and the sofa in the room that it's sitting on have been removed. Files ending in **valid.png** are unfiltered in the frequency domain and unmasked in the tube domain (although the envelope filter is still applied). If you like, this is the cat sitting on the sofa in the room picture". 

The "train" folders in this dataset contains both **train.png** and **valid.png** in an effort to augment the dataset. The test data is flat as we don't have any labels but they are all processed with identical techniques for the files ending valid.png in the training dataset.

The training data is already organised into folders with names species
